associated_diseases.disease_name: Familial isolated hypoparathyroidism due to impaired PTH secretion

associated_diseases.association_type: Disease-causing germline mutation(s) (loss of function) in

genes.context: toms including potentially life-threatening endocrine gland and gastrointestinal dysfunctions. Autoimmune disorders occur when antibodies and immune cells are launched by the body against one or several antigens of its own tissues. APS-1 is caused by changes (mutations) in the autoimmune regulator (AIRE) gene. HLA-DR/DQ genes also play a role in predisposing to which of the component autoimmune disease the patient actually develops.
